alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 10:44AM EDT until April 08 at 3:27PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. At 10.5 feet, Route 413, near Bridgeton Pike in Middletown Township, is subject to closures due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest today at 10.7 feet and then begin falling. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 09/07/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 7.2 Thu 7 pm 4.7 3.7 unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EDT.
